intro: Lupinus luteolus, commonly known as yellow lupin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Lupinus luteolus is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in open fields and along roadsides.
